sen.j: 隆姫女王（たかひめじょおう、長徳元年（995年） - 寛治元年11月22日 (旧暦)（1087年12月19日））は村上天皇第7皇子・具平親王の長女。
sen.e: Princess Takahime (995 - December 19, 1087) was the eldest daughter of Imperial Prince Tomohira, the seventh prince of the Emperor Murakami.
Princess Takahime (995 - December 19, 1087) was the eldest daughter of Imperial Prince Tomohira, the seventh prince of Emperor Murakami.
Princess Takahime (隆姫女王) (995 - December 25, 1087) was the eldest daughter of Imperial Prince Tomohira, the seventh prince of Emperor Murakami.
sen.cmt: 漢字を追加しました。グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.e: Her mother was the second daughter of Imperial Prince Tamehira.

sen.j: 後に藤原頼通の正室となり、高倉北政所と呼ばれた。
sen.e: She later became the legal wife of FUJIWARA no Yorimichi and was called Takakura Kitanomandokoro.

sen.j: 弟は夫頼通の猶子となった源師房（資定王）で、また妹に敦康親王妃、せん子女王（藤原教通室）がいる。
sen.e: Her younger brother was MINAMOTO no Morofusa (prince Sukesada), who became an adopted son of her husband Yorimichi, and the empress of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu and Princess Senshi (the wife of FUJIWARA no Norimichi) were her younger sisters.

sen.j: なお史料によっては隆子女王、隆姫子女王とする表記もある。
sen.e: Depending on historical materials, her name was also written as 隆子女王 (Princess Takako) or 隆姫子女王 (Princess Takahimeko).

sen.j: 『栄花物語』によれば、頼通の父藤原道長は、両親共に皇族の高貴な隆姫との縁談を「男は妻がらなり」と歓迎したという。
sen.e: According to "Eiga Monogatari", FUJIWARA no Michinaga, Yorimichi's father, was pleased with his son's marriage with Takahime, whose parents were Imperial family, saying "The future of a man depends on his wife".

sen.j: 頼通と隆姫の夫婦仲も大変良かった。
sen.e: The marital relationship between Yorimichi and Takahime was pretty good.

sen.j: しかし隆姫には子供はなく、このため三条天皇から頼通へ娘の禔子内親王を降嫁したいと望まれたこともあった。
sen.e: However, as Takahime had no children, the Emperor Sanjo once offerred Yorimichi to marry off his daugter Imperial Princess Teishi to Yorimichi.

sen.j: しかし、頼通は隆姫を悲しませたくないと拒否した。
sen.e: Yorimichi, however, declined the Emperor's offer on the ground that he didn't want to make Takahime sad.

sen.j: さらに病床に伏した頼通の元に具平親王の怨霊が現れたともいわれ、結局沙汰やみになった（その後禔子内親王は頼通の弟藤原教通と結婚している）。
sen.e: This offer of marriage was eventually shelved when what he believed the goast of Imperial Prince Tomohira appeared near Yorimichi, who was then sick in bed (Imperial Princess Teishi later got married with FUJIWARA no Norimichi, Yorimichi's younger brother).

sen.j: とはいえ、とりわけ后候補となる女子に恵まれなかったことは頼通にとっても痛手であり、後に隆姫の姪（妹敦康親王妃の娘）嫄子女王を養女に迎えて後朱雀天皇の中宮とした。
sen.e: However, having no daughters who could be the candidates for the Empress was a big disadvantage for Yorimichi and therefore, he later adopted a niece of Takahime (a daughter of her younger sister, the empress of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu) and sent her into court as Chugu (an empress consort) of the Emperor Gosuzaku.

sen.cmt: 嫄子女王 を追加しました。

sen.j: 古くから頼通は隆姫に頭が上がらなかったために、他の女性との間に生まれた男子を他家に次々と養子に出したと『愚管抄』などにある。
sen.e: Some old historical literatures, including "Gukansho", hold the view that the reason why Yorimichi successively adopted out his sons who were born between other women to other families was because he owed Takahime.

sen.j: しかし、裏づけとなる根拠はなく、むしろ猶子師房の立場を配慮したためとする説もある。
sen.e: However, such view is not supported by reliable evidences and some assert that he did so out of consideration for his adopted son Morofusa rather than the above reason.

sen.j: 従一位に至り康平7年（1064年）11月落飾、1087年に93歳という高齢で薨去。
sen.e: She was conferred the rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank), entered into Buddhist priesthood in November 1064 and died in 1087 at an old age of 93.
